qas.question: How is Detroit's TV market ranked?
How often does the Michigan Chronicle publish?
What province of Canada is a large consumer of Detroit programming?

context: Also founded in 1935 and based in Detroit the <a0_0>Michigan Chronicle<a0_0/> is one of the oldest and most respected African-American <a2_0>weekly<a2_0/> newspapers in America. Covering politics, entertainment, sports and community events. The Detroit television market is the <a1_0>11th largest<a1_0/> in the United States; according to estimates that do not include audiences located in large areas of <a3_0>Ontario<a3_0/>, Canada (Windsor and its surrounding area on broadcast and cable TV, as well as several other cable markets in Ontario, such as the city of Ottawa) which receive and watch Detroit television stations.
